member.name: IMFQualityAdviseLimits.GetMaximumDropMode
member.summary: Gets the maximum drop mode. A higher drop mode means that the object will, if needed, drop samples more aggressively to match the presentation clock.
member.param: Receives the maximum drop mode, specified as a member of the enumeration.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IMFQualityAdviseLimits.GetMinimumQualityLevel
member.summary: Gets the minimum quality level that is supported by the component.
member.param: Receives the minimum quality level, specified as a member of the enumeration.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Queries an object for the number of quality modes it supports. Quality modes are used to adjust the trade-off between quality and speed when rendering audio or video.
The default presenter for the enhanced video renderer (EVR) implements this interface. The EVR uses the interface to respond to quality messages from the quality manager.
